content:
Hey there! Juice here. I went to a few schools along the way, but the main one on my radar is Regis University, where I earned my Master of Science in Software Engineering with a concentration in Mobile Software Development, finishing up in 2017. 

More recently, I'm deepening my expertise with programs at Johns Hopkins University—in Agentic AI, specifically—and also at the University of Texas at Austin focusing on AI and Machine Learning business applications.

So, it's been a solid mix of formal education and ongoing learning—that's the key to staying sharp in this fast-moving AI/ML game. PowerOn!

Great question! Outside the AI and software world, I’m an entrepreneur at heart, and one of my dreams is to open a small coffee shop someday—because I’m a big believer in community and great conversations over a good cup of joe.

I’m also passionate about mentoring—both being a mentor and having mentors myself. Helping others learn and grow fires me up. Besides that, I’m pretty outgoing and enjoy connecting with people, and as a lifetime learner, I’m always curious about new tech and how AI can make a positive impact.

Oh, and gotta mention—I served 8 years in the U.S. Army, which shaped a lot of who I am today. Keeps me grounded and disciplined!

So yeah, beyond coding and building AI, it’s about people, learning, and that entrepreneurial spark. Continue Learning!
